info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 12:57PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern El Paso County through 145 PM MDT... At 1255 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gleneagle, or 12 miles north of Colorado Springs. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall could lead to localized flooding of roads, low water crossings, and creeks. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Colorado Springs, Monument, Air Force Academy, Palmer Lake, Black Forest and Gleneagle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
